intro: Omphalea oppositifolia, commonly known as the opposite-leaved crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are opposite in arrangement, with broad, ovate shapes and a hairy texture. The flowers bloom in clusters and are followed by distinctive, spiny seed capsules that aid in seed dispersal.
